intro: Secamone aegyptiaca, commonly known as Egyptian secamone, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in the spring. Its latex contains alkaloids, which have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes. Secamone aegyptiaca is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in semi-desert environments.
